item.title: Impact of Land Cover on Environmental Processes
item.description: Land cover influence the energy balance, carbon budget, and. hydrological cycle as many different physical characteristics change as a function of land cover, such as albedo, emissivity, roughness, photosynthetic capacity and transpiration.

item.title: Continuous Change Detection and Classification
item.description: It‚Äôs an algorithm used in remote sensing area for land cover analysis. The original methods published form paper titled ‚ÄúContinuous change detection and classification of land cover using all available Landsat data‚Äù, published in 11 February 2014.

item.title: Natural and Anthropogenic Land Cover Change
item.description: Definition: Land cover change refers to the transformation of the physical and biological cover of the earth‚Äôs surface. Natural Causes: Climate Change: Alterations in temperature and precipitation patterns can transform landscapes, such as turning forests into grasslands.

item.title: Google Earth Engine
item.description: Hi Tutorials ¬ß Interpreting Time Series with CCDC.

item.title: SpectralGPT
item.description: Key takeaway ¬ß Universal remote sensing foundation model Trained on one million spectral remote sensing Sentinel-2 images 3 models (Million Parameters): Base (100M), large, (300M) huge (600M) 3D masking strategy, encoder for learning visual representation from spatial-spectral mixed tokens, decoder with multi-target reconstruction for preserving spectrally sequential characteristics Masked autoencoder (MAE) framework, masking rate 90% New benchmark dataset SegMunich, focuses on urban areas Pretrained: 700k data 12 spectral bands from fMoW-S2 200 epoch, 350k BigEarthNet Sentinel-2 100 epoch.

item.title: 5 Principles Prompt Engineering
item.description: Prompt engineering has emerged as a crucial skill for getting the most out of AI tools. There are 5 core principles that can help optimize prompts to make AI models more useful, reliable, and safe.

item.title: Fleeting Notes
item.description: In the context of the Zettelkasten method, ‚Äúfleeting notes‚Äù refer to brief, temporary notes that capture initial thoughts, ideas, or observations. These notes are typically taken quickly and without much detail, serving as a way to capture fleeting thoughts before they are forgotten.
